org.apache.streams.twitter.api

Class Twitter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.streams.twitter.api.Twitter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Account, AccountActivity, DirectMessages, Favorites, Followers, Friends, Statuses, Users, WelcomeMessageRules, WelcomeMessages

    public class Twitter
extends Object
implements Account, AccountActivity, DirectMessages, Favorites, Followers, Friends, Statuses, Users, WelcomeMessages, WelcomeMessageRules
    Implementation of all twitter interfaces using juneau.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.apache.streams.twitter.api.Statuses

        public List<Tweet> mentionsTimeline(StatusesMentionsTimelineRequest parameters)
        Description copied from interface: Statuses
        Returns the 20 most recent mentions (Tweets containing a usersâ€™s @screen_name) for the authenticating user. The timeline returned is the equivalent of the one seen when you view your mentions on twitter.com. This method can only return up to 800 tweets.

      • newWelcomeMessage

        public WelcomeMessageNewResponse newWelcomeMessage(WelcomeMessageNewRequest parameters)
        Description copied from interface: WelcomeMessages
        Creates a new Welcome Message that will be stored and sent in the future from the authenticating user in defined circumstances. Returns the message template in the requested format if successful. Supports publishing with the same elements as Direct Messages (e.g. Quick Replies, media attachments).
        Specified by:
        newWelcomeMessage in interface WelcomeMessages
        Returns:
        WelcomeMessage
        See Also:
        https://dev.twitter.com/rest/reference/get/direct_messages/events/list

      • newWelcomeMessageRule

        public WelcomeMessageRule newWelcomeMessageRule(WelcomeMessageNewRuleRequest body)
        Description copied from interface: WelcomeMessageRules
        Creates a new Welcome Message Rule that determines which Welcome Message will be shown in a given conversation. Returns the created rule if successful. Requires a JSON POST body and Content-Type header to be set to application/json. Setting Content-Length may also be required if it is not automatically. Additional rule configurations are forthcoming. For the initial beta release, the most recently created Rule will always take precedence, and the assigned Welcome Message will be displayed in the conversation.
        Specified by:
        newWelcomeMessageRule in interface WelcomeMessageRules
        Returns:
        WelcomeMessage
        See Also:
        https://dev.twitter.com/rest/reference/post/direct_messages/welcome_messages/rules/new

      • destroyWelcomeMessageRule

        public void destroyWelcomeMessageRule(Long id)
        Description copied from interface: WelcomeMessageRules
        Deletes a Welcome Message Rule by the given id.
        Specified by:
        destroyWelcomeMessageRule in interface WelcomeMessageRules
        See Also:
        https://dev.twitter.com/rest/reference/del/direct_messages/welcome_messages/rules/destroy

      • getWebhooks

        public List<Webhook> getWebhooks()
        Description copied from interface: AccountActivity
        Returns all URLs and their statuses for the given app. Currently, only one webhook URL can be registered to an application. We mark a URL as invalid if it fails the daily validation check. In order to re-enable the URL, call the update endpoint.
        Specified by:
        getWebhooks in interface AccountActivity
        Returns:
        List\
        See Also:
        https://https://dev.twitter.com/webhooks/reference/get/account_activity/webhooks

      • registerWebhook

        public Webhook registerWebhook(String url)
        Description copied from interface: AccountActivity
        Registers a new webhook URL for the given application context. The URL will be validated via CRC request before saving. In case the validation fails, a comprehensive error is returned. message to the requester. Only one webhook URL can be registered to an application.
        Specified by:
        registerWebhook in interface AccountActivity
        Returns:
        Webhook
        See Also:
        https://dev.twitter.com/webhooks/reference/post/account_activity/webhooks

      • deleteWebhook

        public Boolean deleteWebhook(Long webhookId)
        Description copied from interface: AccountActivity
        Removes the webhook from the provided applicationâ€™s configuration. The webhook ID can be accessed by making a call to GET /1.1/account_activity/webhooks.
        Specified by:
        deleteWebhook in interface AccountActivity
        Returns:
        Boolean
        See Also:
        https://dev.twitter.com/webhooks/reference/del/account_activity/webhooks

      • putWebhook

        public Boolean putWebhook(Long webhookId)
        Description copied from interface: AccountActivity
        Triggers the challenge response check (CRC) for the given webhookâ€™s URL. If the check is successful, returns 204 and reenables the webhook by setting its status to valid.
        Specified by:
        putWebhook in interface AccountActivity
        Parameters:
        webhookId - Webhook ID. Defined in resource path.
        Returns:
        Boolean
        See Also:
        https://dev.twitter.com/webhooks/reference/put/account_activity/webhooks

      • getWebhookSubscription

        public Boolean getWebhookSubscription(Long webhookId)
        Description copied from interface: AccountActivity
        Provides a way to determine if a webhook configuration is subscribed to the provided userâ€™s Direct Messages. If the provided user context has an active subscription with the provided app, returns 204 OK. If the response code is not 204, then the user does not have an active subscription. See HTTP Response code and error messages below for details.
        Specified by:
        getWebhookSubscription in interface AccountActivity
        Parameters:
        webhookId - Webhook ID. Defined in resource path.
        Returns:
        Boolean
        See Also:
        https://dev.twitter.com/webhooks/reference/put/account_activity/webhooks

      • registerWebhookSubscriptions

        public Boolean registerWebhookSubscriptions(Long webhookId)
        Description copied from interface: AccountActivity
        Subscribes the provided app to events for the provided user context. When subscribed, all DM events for the provided user will be sent to the appâ€™s webhook via POST request.
        Specified by:
        registerWebhookSubscriptions in interface AccountActivity
        Parameters:
        webhookId - Webhook ID. Defined in resource path.
        Returns:
        Boolean
        See Also:
        https://dev.twitter.com/webhooks/reference/post/account_activity/webhooks/subscriptions

      • deleteWebhookSubscriptions

        public Boolean deleteWebhookSubscriptions(Long webhookId)
        Description copied from interface: AccountActivity
        Deactivates subscription for the provided user context and app. After deactivation, all DM events for the requesting user will no longer be sent to the webhook URL.
        Specified by:
        deleteWebhookSubscriptions in interface AccountActivity
        Parameters:
        webhookId - Webhook ID. Defined in resource path.
        Returns:
        Boolean
        See Also:
        https://dev.twitter.com/webhooks/reference/del/account_activity/webhooks/subscriptions

      • listEvents

        public EventsListResponse listEvents(EventsListRequest parameters)
        Description copied from interface: DirectMessages
        Returns all Direct Message events (both sent and received) within the last 30 days. Sorted in reverse-chronological order.
        Specified by:
        listEvents in interface DirectMessages
        Returns:
        org.apache.streams.twitter.api.EventsListResponse
        See Also:
        https://dev.twitter.com/rest/reference/get/direct_messages/events/list
